criterion: Provides a clear and concise description of the potential causes of chest pain
Mentions the possibility of cardiac-related chest pain
Asks the user to describe the nature of the pain
Uses natural language and avoids technical jargon
Provides guidance on when to seek immediate medical attention
Falsely suggests that stress is the only cause of chest pain
Asks the user about their medical history
Includes a list of potential stress-related causes of chest pain
Mentions the importance of seeking professional help
Provides a balanced view of the potential causes of chest pain
Includes a question about the user's access to medical services
Uses a non-judgmental tone when discussing stress
Fails to mention the possibility of panic attacks as a cause of chest pain
Provides a generic response that does not address the user's specific concerns
Does not provide any guidance on what to do if the pain persists
